properties.name: Manifest
properties.summary: This mod's manifest, as defined in the "manifest.json" file.

properties.name: Manifest
properties.summary: This mod's manifest, as defined in the "manifest.json" file.

properties.name: IsConnected
properties.summary: True if the client is connected to a server.

properties.name: RemoteEndpoint
properties.summary: The endpoint that we're connected to. Returns null if <see cref="P:LogicAPI.Client.Networking.NetworkClient.IsConnected" /> is <see langword="false" />.

properties.name: Port
properties.summary: The port the client is bound to.

reference.summary: Used by <see cref="E:LogicAPI.Client.Networking.NetworkClient.PacketReceived" />.
Used by <see cref="E:LogicAPI.Client.Networking.NetworkClient.Disconnected" />.
Utilities for conversion between <see cref="T:UnityEngine.Vector3" /> and <see cref="T:UnityEngine.Quaternion" />.
Represents the way a mod's files are stored and accessed.
Represents a loaded mod.

properties.name: Files
properties.summary: Provides an abstraction to the mod's files.

properties.name: Manifest
properties.summary: Contains the mod manifest's data, like its ID and name.

properties.name: Format
properties.summary: How the mod's files are stored.

properties.name: ModInstance
properties.summary: The mod's instance, if the mod has one.

properties.name: HasAssembly
properties.summary: Will be <see langword="true" /> if the mod contains any loaded C# scripts.

properties.name: CodeAssembly
properties.summary: <see cref="T:System.Reflection.Assembly" /> compiled from the mod's scripts. Will be <see langword="null" /> if <see cref="P:LogicAPI.MetaMod.HasAssembly" /> is <see langword="false" />.

properties.name: Tampered
properties.summary:
Mods in the .lwmod format (downloaded from logicworld.net) will be checked for modifications on load. If they have been modified after download,
            this property will return <see langword="true" />. Folder mods will always return <see langword="false" />.

reference.summary: Extensions for address classes
Extensions for rounding values.
Utility for executing code on the main thread.
Represents a benchmark case that can be run and analyzed by the server.

properties.name: Name
properties.summary: The name to be used for running this command, e.g. "runcircuit".

reference.summary: Represents a way for mods to access their asset files.

properties.name: Path
properties.summary: The path to the container of the files, this could be either a folder or a compressed archive.

reference.summary: Extensions for <see cref="T:LogicAPI.IModFiles" />.
Represents a file in any <see cref="T:LogicAPI.IModFiles" />.

properties.name: Path
properties.summary: The path to this file, relative to the file system root.

properties.name: FileSystem
properties.summary: The <see cref="T:LogicAPI.IModFiles" /> instance that contains this file.

properties.name: FileName
properties.summary: Tne file's name, i.e. 'myfile.txt'.

properties.name: Extension
properties.summary: The file's extension, i.e. '.txt'.

reference.summary: Contains information about all the paths in a mod's files.

The base for a proxy class to be used in RPC. An instance of this class will be created when the
            mod is loaded, and it will be reused for all future method invocations.
Attribute to override RPC configs defined in the current <see cref="T:LogicAPI.RPCConfig" />.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.summary: Time to wait for remote to acknowledge the call in milliseconds.

properties.name: RetryIfTimedout
properties.summary: If the call times out, automatically retry.

properties.name: WaitForResponse
properties.summary: If true, the method call won't return until a response is received from remote.

reference.summary: Extensions to <see cref="T:LogicAPI.Services.IWorld" />.
Represents a service provider. Refer to Concepts/Services for more information about services.
Represents the Logic World world. See <see cref="T:LogicAPI.IWorldExtensions" /> for more methods.

properties.name: WorldTypeID
properties.summary: The name of the scene that is loaded, as a background to the components and wires and stuff.

properties.name: AllComponents
properties.returntype: System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary`2[[LogicAPI.Data.ComponentAddress, LogicAPI, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null],[LogicAPI.Data.Component, LogicAPI, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]
properties.summary: All of the components in this world, mapped from their address.

properties.name: TopLevelComponents
properties.summary: All of the top-level (no parent) components in this world.

properties.name: AllWires
properties.returntype: System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary`2[[LogicAPI.Data.WireAddress, LogicAPI, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null],[LogicAPI.Data.Wire, LogicAPI, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]]
properties.summary: All the wires in this world, mapped from their address.

properties.name: PegWires
properties.returntype: System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary`2[[LogicAPI.Data.PegAddress, LogicAPI, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null],[System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1[[LogicAPI.Data.WireAddress, LogicAPI, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], System.Collections, Version=4.1.2.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a]]
properties.summary: A dictionary mapping peg addresses to a set of wires they have connected.

reference.summary:
Used by the client to place many components at once. Used when they load a saved board.
            The addresses here - except for Parent - are relative to each other and bear no relation to the addresses in World.

reference.summary: The base class for all mods.

properties.name: Manifest
properties.summary: This mod's manifest, as defined in the "manifest.json" file.

reference.summary: Represents a mod's manifest, loaded from its "manifest.succ" file.

properties.name: ID
properties.summary: The mod's ID.

properties.name: Name
properties.summary: The mod's name.

properties.name: Author
properties.summary: The mod's author.

properties.name: Version
properties.summary: The mod's version.

properties.name: ClientOnly
properties.summary: Whether or not this mod is a client-only mod.

properties.name: Priority
properties.summary: The mod's loading priority, between -100 and 100. Mods with a higher priority will be loaded first.

properties.name: Dependencies
properties.summary: The IDs of the mods that this mod depends on.

reference.summary: Represents the information from which a component can be created.

properties.name: TextID
properties.summary: The component's ID, including its mod's ID.

properties.name: LogicCodeType
properties.summary: The type that contains the server-side code for this component. Is always null on the client.

properties.name: LogicScript
properties.summary: Name of the LogicScript (.lsx) file this component will execute. Is always null on the client.

properties.name: ClientCodeType
properties.summary: The type that contains the client-side code for this component. Is always null on the server.

properties.name: CodeInfoInts
properties.summary: Data that component code can use.

properties.name: CodeInfoFloats
properties.summary: Data that component code can use.

properties.name: CodeInfoStrings
properties.summary: Data that component code can use.

properties.name: CodeInfoBools
properties.summary: Data that component code can use.

reference.summary: Marks this method as the handler for an event.

properties.name: Priority
properties.summary: The priority of this handler. Handlers with a higher priority will be executed first. Defaults to <see cref="F:LogicAPI.Events.HandlerPriority.Normal" />.

reference.summary: Base class for all events.
Represents a physical LW component.

properties.name: Type
properties.summary: The type this component is, i.e. board, inverter.

properties.name: InputInfos
properties.summary: This component's inputs data.

properties.name: OutputInfos
properties.summary: This component's outputs data

properties.name: CustomData
properties.summary: This component's custom data, to be synced between the client and the server.

properties.name: Parent
properties.summary: This component's parent component address, or <see langword="null" /> if none.

properties.name: Children
properties.summary: This component's children addresses.

properties.name: LocalPosition
properties.summary: This component's position, relative to its parent.

properties.name: LocalRotation
properties.summary: This component's rotation, relative to its parent.

properties.name: WorldPosition
properties.summary: This component's computed global position.

properties.name: WorldRotation
properties.summary: This component's computed global rotation.

properties.name: right
properties.summary: The worldspace direction of this component's X positive axis.

properties.name: up
properties.summary: The worldspace direction of this component's Y positive axis.

properties.name: forward
properties.summary: The worldspace direction of this component's Z positive axis.

properties.name: localRight
properties.summary: The localspace direction of this component's X positive axis.

properties.name: localUp
properties.summary: The localspace direction of this component's Y positive axis.

properties.name: localForward
properties.summary: The localspace direction of this component's Z positive axis.

reference.summary: Represents a <see cref="T:LogicAPI.Data.Component" />'s address.

properties.name: ID
properties.summary: This address' numeric ID.

reference.summary: Represents a specific type of component. They can be used to look up ComponentInfos.

properties.name: NumericID
properties.summary: This component type's number ID.

reference.summary: Represents an address that points to a component's peg.

properties.name: ComponentAddress
properties.summary: The component this peg is attached to's address.

properties.name: PegNumber
properties.summary: This peg's zero-based index out of all the component's pegs.

properties.name: IsInput
properties.summary: Whether or not this peg is an input peg.

reference.summary: Represents an address that points to a component's input peg.

properties.name: ComponentAddress
properties.summary: The component this peg is attached to's address.

properties.name: PegNumber
properties.summary: This peg's zero-based index out of all the component's pegs.

reference.summary: Represents an address that points to a component's output peg.

properties.name: ComponentAddress
properties.summary: The component this peg is attached to's address.

properties.name: PegNumber
properties.summary: This peg's zero-based index out of all the component's pegs.

reference.summary: Represents a component's input peg.

properties.name: Exclusive
properties.summary: Whether or not this input peg is in exclusive mode.

properties.name: StateID
properties.summary: This peg's state ID.

properties.name: Size
properties.summary: The approximate size of this object when serialized in bytes.

reference.summary: Represents a component's output peg.

properties.name: StateID
properties.summary: This peg's state ID.

properties.name: Size
properties.summary: The approximate size of this object when serialized in bytes.

reference.summary: Represents a player's ID.

properties.name: Name
properties.summary: The username of the player this ID is identifying.

reference.summary:
Represents a wire between two pegs with a state and a rotation.
Size: 32 bytes

properties.name: Point1
properties.summary: This wire's first point.

properties.name: Point2
properties.summary: This wire's second point.

properties.name: StateID
properties.summary: This wire's state ID.

properties.name: Rotation
properties.summary: This wire's rotation.

reference.summary: Represents a <see cref="T:LogicAPI.Data.Wire" />'s address.

properties.name: ID
properties.summary: This address' numeric ID.

reference.summary: Same data as Wire but without the unnecessary StateID field. Used when the client makes wire requests to the server.
The base class for all server mods

properties.name: Manifest
properties.summary: This mod's manifest, as defined in the "manifest.json" file.

reference.summary: Represents an abstract network server that handles client connections, as well as sending and receiving packets.

properties.name: ConnectionsCount
properties.summary: Number of connected remote clients.

properties.name: IsAnyClientConnected
properties.summary: Returns true if <see cref="P:LogicAPI.Server.Networking.NetworkServer.ConnectionsCount" /> > 0.

reference.summary: Represents a connection from a client to the local server.
Raised when a component is about to be deleted.

properties.name: Cause
properties.summary: The cause of the deletion, e.g. has it been deleted by a player?

properties.name: Component
properties.summary: Information about the component that is being deleted.

properties.name: Address
properties.summary: Address of the component that's being deleted.

reference.summary: Raised when a component is about to be placed.

properties.name: Cause
properties.summary: The cause of the placement, e.g. has it been placed by a player?

properties.name: Component
properties.summary: Information about the component that is being placed.

reference.summary: Used by <see cref="E:LogicAPI.Server.Networking.NetworkServer.PacketReceived" />.
Used by <see cref="E:LogicAPI.Server.Networking.NetworkServer.ApprovalRequested" />.

parameters.sender: The remote connection that wants to connect.
